intro: Willoughbya latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved willoughbya, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pale yellow to orange flowers. The plant is typically found in swampy or wetland habitats, thriving in moist, clay soils. It is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value, though it can be invasive in certain environments. Willoughbya latifolia is also valued for its historical use in traditional medicine by Indigenous communities.
